External functions enable integration between Drapo applications and external JavaScript functions. This function family allows you to bridge the gap between Drapo's data-driven framework and custom JavaScript code, third-party libraries, or iframe-embedded content.

External Function Family

The External function family includes several variants for different use cases:

  • External() - Basic external function placeholder that returns an empty string
  • SetExternal() - Passes Drapo data to an external JavaScript function
  • GetExternal() - Retrieves data from an external JavaScript function into Drapo storage
  • SetExternalFrame() - Passes data to external functions within iframes
  • GetExternalFrame() - Retrieves data from external functions within iframes
  • SetExternalFrameMessage() - Uses postMessage API to send data to iframe functions
  • GetExternalFrameMessage() - Uses postMessage API to receive data from iframe functions

Common Use Cases

  • Integrating with third-party JavaScript libraries (charts, maps, etc.)
  • Communicating with embedded iframes or widgets
  • Calling custom business logic implemented in JavaScript
  • Bridging Drapo applications with existing legacy JavaScript code
  • Creating reusable JavaScript utilities that can be called from Drapo

Security Considerations

When using external functions, consider:

  • Validate external function existence before calling
  • Use the clone parameter to prevent unwanted data mutations
  • Sanitize data when communicating with untrusted external sources
  • Be cautious with iframe communications and origin validation
